data.title: ANALYSIS OF INTRINSIC OF SHORT STORY BY JOHN GLASWORTHY ENTITLED QUALITY
data.meta_description: ANALYSIS OF INTRINSIC OF SHORT STORY BY JOHN GLASWORTHY ENTITLED QUALITY - Download as a PDF or view online for free
data.text:
1. HARUN ARROSYID NIM : 1503406002 PRODI : Bhs Inggris SEMESTER : III ( Tiga ) UNIVERSITAS ISLAM JEMBER

3.  The setting of aleterary work is the time and place of the action  Place  Country, State, Region, Community, Neigbhorhood, Building, Instituti on, Or home.  Time  The year, The time of day, Even the weather. 1. Setting

4.  The theme of a letarary work is its central message, concern, or purpose. 2. Theme

5. Plot is the literary element that discribes the structure of a story, It shows arrangement of erents and actions within a story. Plot Component :  Exposition  Rising Action  Climax  Falling Action  Resolution / Denoument  Plot :  Character vs Other’s Character  Character vs Society  Character vs Character  Character vs Self 3. Plot

6.  Point of view is the perspective from which a story is told. It is the relationship of the Narrator to the Story 4. Point Of View  First – Person is told by a character who uses the first pronoun “I”  Third – Person limited point of view is the point of view where the Narrator uses Third – Person pronouns such as “he” and “she” to refer to the character

7.  Character is the moral strength or the gualities making a person or thing what he, she, or it is. 5. Character

8.   Two Rent Tenements, Central London ( Paragraph 1 )  Theatres, Shops And Hotels ( Paragraph 1 )  London ( Paragraph 4 ) 6. Place

9.   One Morning ( Paragraph 3 )  After About One Year ( Paragraph 4 )  A Week Passed ( Paragraph 5 ) 7. Time

10.   “Quality is the most Valuable” # It shows in the paragraph 3, that says “Mr. Gessler was very disciplidned, once he heard the request from his customer, He would finish the boots as soon as he could, He would make the boots with the authentic materials it means that he wanted to give priority to the quality of the boots he made”. ( Proof ) 8. Theme

11.  The structure of story shows that the story is running forward and belong to kind of conflict in Character vs Other’s Character The Plot Components 1. Exposition ( Described in paragraph 1 & 2 ) 2. Rising Action ( Described in Paragraph 3 ) 3. Climax ( Described in Paragraph 4 ) 4. Falling Action ( Described in Paragraph 4 & 5 ) 5. Resolution ( Described in Paragraph 5 ) 9. Plot

12.  The Story of “Quality” by John Galsworthy is belong to told by Third-Person where the Narator uses Third-Person pronouns suchas “he” and “she” to refer to the characters. And the Proofes are spread out All of the Paragraphs, included paragraph 1, 2, 3, 4 dan 5. 10. Point Of View
